meanings.definition: Having two lips or lip-like parts
meanings.sent1: The flower had a bilabiate shape, with two distinct petals resembling lips.
meanings.sent2: The insect had a bilabiate mouth, allowing it to easily sip nectar from flowers.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's bilabiate smile made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a bilabiate doorway, welcoming visitors with its unique design.
meanings.sent5: The bilabiate design of the mask made it stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Having two lips or lip-like parts that are fused together at the base
meanings.sent1: The pitcher plant had a bilabiate structure, trapping insects inside.
meanings.sent2: The turtle's bilabiate beak helped it catch fish in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The bilabiate flower looked like it was giving a kiss to the sun.
meanings.sent4: The bilabiate opening of the cave seemed like a mysterious gateway.
meanings.sent5: The bilabiate design of the sculpture symbolized unity and strength.

meanings.definition: Having two lips or lip-like parts that are separate and distinct
meanings.sent1: The bilabiate leaves of the plant fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The bird's bilabiate bill helped it crack open seeds easily.
meanings.sent3: The bilabiate pattern on the fabric looked like a pair of lips.
meanings.sent4: The bilabiate structure of the building added an interesting touch to the architecture.
meanings.sent5: The bilabiate design of the logo made it memorable and eye-catching.
